alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 7:40PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A snow squall will affect Western Rock island...Northwestern Louisa...Cedar...Johnson...Eastern Washington...Western Jones... Muscatine and Linn counties through 845 PM CST... At 739 PM CST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from near Tipton to 7 miles north of Wellman. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Snow...flash freeze and winds in excess of 40 mph SOURCES...Radar and observations. IMPACTS...Ice covered surfaces including roadways, bridges, overpasses, and sidewalks. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Iowa City, Muscatine, Washington, Anamosa, Tipton, West Branch, Durant, Mechanicsville, Stanwood, Marion, Coralville, North Liberty, Hiawatha, Mount Vernon, West Liberty, Robins, Wilton, Kalona and Lisbon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 229 and 277. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 30. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads could lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. A rapid drop in temperatures will lead to the rapid formation of black ice on area roadways. Black ice is nearly impossible to see and roadways may appear wet. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington
